column4: I need help playing DVDs, I've followed all the guides I can find, and I've installed every package I can... no matter what I try, I always get the same problem - it stutters and skips and it's just unwatchable, can anyone help me pelase?
tried mplayer dvd:// ?
sorry, what do you mean? I've tried using lots of different media players, it's always the exact same
I typed it into the terminal, I have a bunch of text now, what should I be looking for?
or just try to play one of the VOBs using mplayer.
when I start browsing the DVD my whole computer starts stuttering... could this mean the hardware is the problem?
I've tried opening the VOBs in mplayer, exactly the same thing happens
if you copy them to hdd first too?
I've copied a file over, it won't run though, and it has a little padlock icon. But since the whole computer stutters when I'm browsing the DVD, I'm guessing the hardware is at fault?
wait, nevermind, I'm able to open it in VLC, it still stutters
so something is too slow I guess? it also stutters from hdd? is your video card using it proper driver?
when I was using windows DVDs played fine, so it's not a hardware issue. I've installed graphics drivers and I can play other media files fine, so I think my graphics card is working okay
but yeah it is stuttering from the hard drive, so maybe my computer is having problems playing the VOG format..?
is it an old computer?
it's not amazingly new but like I say, DVDs still run find under windows
what video card=
ATI Radeon HD 2600 XT
and X is using the ati driver or just vesa?
I'm pretty sure I installed an ATI driver when I installed ubuntu, I was initially having similar problems playing any media at all, but after I installed the drivers it started working
sorry if I'm being impatient, but are you still with me man?
yes, but I'm out of ideas, sorry!
don't worry man, thanks for the help :)
